WHO RECOMMENDATIONS ON POSTNATAL CARE OF THE MOTHER AND NEWBORN
Overall, the quality of evidence was assessed as either low or very low. The majority of the 
studies comprised small sample sizes, were unblinded due to the nature of the interven -
tions and were conducted in developed countries. 
Considerations in development of recommendations
There was insufficient evidence to recommend specific interventions for prevention of
